t: Psalm 10
Need for God’s Justice
Lord,*spn why do you stand so far away? Why*ln do you hide in times of trouble?
In*ln arrogance the wicked relentlessly pursue their victims; let*ln them be caught in the schemes they have devised.
For*pn the wicked one boasts about his own cravings; the*ln one who is greedy curses and despises the Lord.*s
In*ln all his scheming, the*ln wicked person arrogantly thinks, “There’s*ln no accountability, since*ln there’s no God.”
His*ln ways are always secure; your*ln lofty judgments have no effect on him; he*ln scoffs at all his adversaries.
He*ln says to himself, “I will never be moved — from*ln generation to generation I will be without calamity.”
Cursing,*ln deceit, and violence fill his mouth; trouble*ln and malice are under his tongue.
He*ln waits in ambush near settlements; he*ln kills the innocent in secret places. His*ln eyes are on the lookout for the helpless;
he*ln lurks in secret like a lion in a thicket. He*ln lurks in order to seize a victim; he*ln seizes a victim and drags him in his net.
So*ln he is oppressed and beaten down; helpless*ln people fall because of the wicked one’s strength.
He*ln says to himself, “God has forgotten; he*ln hides his face and will never see.”
Rise*pn up, Lord*s God! Lift up your hand. Do*ln not forget the oppressed.
Why*ln has the wicked person despised God? He*ln says to himself, “You will not demand an account.”
But*ln you yourself have seen trouble and grief, observing*ln it in order to take the matter into your hands. The*ln helpless one entrusts himself to you; you*ln are a helper of the fatherless.
Break*ln the arm of the wicked, evil person, until*ln you look for his wickedness, but*ln it can’t be found.
The*pn Lord*s is King forever and ever; the*ln nations will perish from his land.
Lord,*sln you have heard the desire of the humble; you*ln will strengthen their hearts. You*ln will listen carefully,
doing*ln justice for the fatherless and the oppressed so*ln that mere humans from the earth may terrify them no more.
